column4: hello people, im just about to venture into the world of trying to get WoW to work in ubuntu. I have the website here to follow but I need to ask  one thing. It says that I can copy the WoW folder over from my windows installation, fair one, but can I do that if the installation is on another partition on the same disk as ubuntu?
I don't see why that would matter
blimey that all looks a bit complicated, I have only been using Linux for about a month
you should just have to click on your ntfs partition in nautilus.  Or use the gui ntfs-config...
right, how do i define what the default shell is?
yeah, it keeps defaulting to /bin/sh even after changing
wait.  /bin/sh isn't the default interactive shell anyway.
It is when you create a new user
how are you creating the new user?
I already created it. I am using it now. I just want to change from /bin/sh to /bin/bash , apparently you have to logout and back in for it to take affect. I just ssh'd into myself and its bash then.
can you please answer my question?
